intro: Diapedium congestum, commonly known as the clustered diapedium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Diapedium congestum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
